title: Pilot
description: Clueless Dunder Mifflin manager Michael Scott welcomes a documentary crew to observe the office just as he learns that his branch could be downsized.

title: Diversity Day
description: After receiving complaints about an employee's unsolicited repeat performance of a risqué comedy routine, Michael leads a diversity training session.

title: Health Care
description: The company is cutting back on health care, which means switching to a plan with fewer benefits. Michael sends Dwight to tell the employees.

title: The Alliance
description: With rumors of downsizing floating around the office, a nervous Dwight approaches Jim about forming an alliance to protect their jobs.

title: Basketball
description: After planning a basketball game between the office and warehouse workers, Michael picks his "dream team" -- led by the company's sole black employee.

title: Hot Girl
description: When an attractive woman shows up on the premises to sell handbags, Michael sees an opportunity for a red-hot office romance.

title: The Dundies
description: When corporate won't pay for the annual employee appreciation awards ceremony, Michael is forced to create a memorable evening on a shoestring budget.

title: Sexual Harassment
description: When HR announces a crackdown on sexual harassment, Michael is forced to curb his habit of forwarding inappropriate e-mails to his underlings.

title: Office Olympics
description: With Michael and Dwight out of the office on a "work-related" condo search, Jim and Pam hold the first Dunder-Mifflin Olympic Games.

title: The Fire
description: To pass the time during an unplanned fire drill, Jim organizes games of "Desert Island," "Would You Rather..." and "Who Would You Do?"

title: Halloween
description: As he watches his employees prepare for the office's annual Halloween party, Michael agonizes over which of them he'll fire.

title: The Fight
description: When Dwight, who holds a purple belt in karate, knocks out Michael during a playful scuffle, his humiliated boss invites everyone to a rematch.

title: The Client
description: Declaring Chili's "the new golf course," Michael convinces Jan that it's a great place to woo an important client.

title: Performance Review
description: Instead of talking to his employees about their work, Michael uses their annual review time to gather feedback on his "relationship" with Jan.

title: Email Surveillance
description: While monitoring his employees' e-mails, Michael stumbles upon an invitation to a barbecue at Jim's apartment that Michael was not invited to.

title: Christmas Party
description: Flush with cash from a recent bonus, Michael throws an office Christmas party. Jim begins planning the perfect Secret Santa gift for Pam.

title: Booze Cruise
description: The staff sets sail on a "booze cruise" that was chartered by Michael to boost office morale and kick-start a day of leadership training.

title: The Injury
description: In an unprecedented breakfast-in-bed accident, Michael burns his foot on a George Foreman Grill and demands that his staff caters to his every whim.

title: The Secret
description: Frantic that a tactless Michael will reveal his secret crush on Pam, Jim tries desperately to bond with him over an uncomfortable lunch at Hooters.

title: The Carpet
description: A stench in Michael's office leads to a game of musical chairs, prompting Michael to take over Jim's cubicle and reminisce about his past.

title: Boys and Girls
description: When Jan holds a "Women in the Workplace" seminar for the female employees, a jealous Michael retaliates by gathering the men for their own meeting.

title: Valentine's Day
description: Michael and Jan head to New York City for a corporate meeting on Valentine's Day, prompting rumors that they're actually an item.

title: Dwight's Speech
description: After being named Salesman of the Year, Dwight must confront his fear of public speaking. Pam announces that she and Roy have set a wedding date.

title: Take Your Daughter to Work Day
description: "Take Your Daughter to Work Day" sets the stage for a series of classic Michael gaffes.

title: Michael's Birthday
description: Determined to enjoy his birthday despite everyone's anxiety over whether Kevin has skin cancer, Michael takes the entire crew to an ice-skating rink.

title: Drug Testing
description: After finding a half-smoked joint, Dwight launches an investigation to find the culprit and earns the honorary title of official security supervisor.

title: Conflict Resolution
description: When Michael takes over Toby's conflict-resolution duties, his approach of encouraging "cooperation through confrontation" may ruin office morale.

title: Casino Night
description: Michael finds himself trapped in an awkward love triangle when his boss, Jan, and his realtor, Carole, both accept his invitation to casino night.

title: Gay Witch Hunt
description: Jim tries to adjust to his promotion and life away from Pam. Back in Scranton, Michael teams with Dwight to identify the homosexuals in the office.

title: The Convention
description: At a convention, Michael and Dwight connect with Jim for a crazy party in their hotel room. Pam prepares for her first date since her breakup.

title: The Coup
description: Jan arrives during Michael's "Movie Monday" and is mad that nobody is working. Dwight secretly meets with Jan about taking over Michael's job.

title: Grief Counseling
description: Michael looks for a way to properly honor his former mentor, while Jim's co-workers start to resent him when the boss gives him more responsibilities.

title: Initiation
description: Dwight gives Ryan a lesson in salesmanship and takes him to the family beet farm. Michael and Stanley eagerly anticipate their free yummy treats.

title: Diwali
description: When Kelly invites the staff to attend a Hindu festival, Michael takes the opportunity to bring everyone closer and later makes a big announcement.

title: Branch Closing
description: The mood in the office takes a depressing turn when Jan informs Michael that Dunder Mifflin's board plans to close the Scranton branch.

title: The Merger
description: With Stamford's employees joining the Scranton team -- reuniting Pam and Jim -- Michael tries to impress everyone with a special welcome video.

title: The Convict
description: Michael suspects one of the new Stamford transfers is an ex-con. Andy turns to Jim for advice about how to win Pam over.

title: A Benihana Christmas
description: Michael makes a special Christmas greeting card for Carol. Meanwhile, Angela, Pam and Karen don't see eye to eye about the annual yuletide party.

title: Back from Vacation
description: When Karen moves next door to Jim, the two have their first major argument. Michael lets a big secret slip while showing pictures of his Jamaica trip.

title: Traveling Salesmen
description: Jim and Dwight are forced to team up when Michael sends the staff out on sales calls. Later, Michael chooses Andy as his partner.

title: The Return
description: Andy maneuvers to be Michael's second in command and irritates everyone, especially Jim. The party-planning committee prepares for Oscar's return.

title: Ben Franklin
description: Michael hires adult entertainers to spice up Phyllis' wedding shower. Meanwhile, Karen asks Pam whether she still has feelings for Jim.

title: Phyllis's Wedding
description: Michael is honored when given the task of pushing Phyllis' dad down the aisle at her wedding. Dwight wants to ensure that no one crashes the ceremony.

title: Business School
description: While Pam enters an art exhibition, Ryan brings Michael to his business class as a guest speaker. Back at the office, Dwight tries to capture a bat.

title: Cocktails
description: During a party at the chief financial officer's home, Michael spills the beans about his relationship with Jan. And Pam gets assertive with Roy.

title: The Negotiation
description: An angry Roy storms into the office looking to hurt Jim, but an unexpected hero stops him. Darryl and Michael negotiate Darryl's pay raise.

title: Safety Training
description: During safety-training day, Michael is determined to show everyone that safety is no joke, and Dwight helps him prepare an over-the-top demonstration.

title: Product Recall
description: Paper with an obscene watermark is inadvertently sent out, sending Michael into damage-control mode and forcing Angela to deal with angry callers.

title: Women's Appreciation
description: When Phyllis gets flashed, Michael organizes a special outing for the ladies to boost their morale as Andy and Dwight try to track down the culprit.

title: Beach Games
description: Michael takes the staff for a day of fun at Lake Scranton, but the fun stops when he divides everyone into tribes and forces them to compete in challenges.

title: The Job
description: Karen and Jim interview for an opening at the corporate offices, though Michael thinks he has the job sewn up. Jan wants another chance with Michael.

title: Fun Run
description: A freak accident spurs Michael to organize an employee charity run. Jim and Pam go public with their love. Dwight destroys Angela's personal property.

title: Dunder Mifflin Infinity
description: Newly promoted Ryan returns to the Scranton branch and receives a cold reception to his announcement of the company's new website.

title: Launch Party
description: Dwight tries to beat the company's new website in one-day sales. Michael retaliates when he isn't invited to the site launch party in New York.

title: Money
description: Jan's excessive spending causes major money problems for Michael. Jim and Pam spend an unforgettable night on Dwight's farm.

title: Local Ad
description: Michael writes, produces and directs a commercial promoting the Scranton branch. Brokenhearted Dwight learns an intriguing secret about Angela.

title: Branch Wars
description: Furious when Karen offers Stanley a position at her office branch in Utica, Michael tricks Jim into joining him and Dwight in a prank against her.

title: Survivor Man
description: When Michael is excluded from an executive retreat in the woods, he treats himself to a lone "Survivor Man" style campout.

title: The Deposition
description: Jan tries to manipulate Michael in a bogus lawsuit against Dunder Mifflin. Pam is incensed when Kelly gloats over an incident between Jim and Darryl.

title: Dinner Party
description: The employees witness Michael's dysfunctional relationship with Jan at a dinner party, and Dwight tries to make Angela jealous with an unusual date.

title: The Chair Model
description: Dunder Mifflin loses two assigned parking spaces, and Michael's infatuation with a catalog model makes him reconsider his relationship with Jan.

title: Night Out
description: Michael and Dwight go clubbing with Ryan. Back at the office, Jim's plan to save the staff from a Saturday at the office backfires.

title: Did I Stutter
description: Stanley disrespects Michael in front of the other employees, and a used-car purchase between Dwight and Andy creates a major rift.

title: Job Fair
description: Michael, Pam, Oscar and Darryl attend a job fair at Pam's alma mater. Across town, Jim attempts his first "hard sell" over a round of golf.

title: Goodbye, Toby
description: On Toby's last day at the company, Michael falls in love with his replacement. Jim's elaborate plans for his proposal to Pam are derailed.

title: Weight Loss: Part 1
description: A company weight loss initiative has everyone obsessed with their diet. Michael pursues a friendship with his new HR rep and Jim pops the question.

title: Weight Loss: Part 2
description: The office continues its efforts to win the Dunder Mifflin weight loss initiative. Meanwhile, Jim misses Pam, who's attending art school in New York.

title: Business Ethics
description: Holly's business ethics seminar gets out of control when Michael lets everyone speak freely about their unethical behavior at work.

title: Baby Shower
description: Michael prepares for Jan's baby by having Dwight go over various birthing scenarios, and tells Holly he'll pretend to dislike her for Jan's benefit.

title: Crime Aid
description: Michael and Holly get an early start on their date night. When the office is robbed, Michael holds an auction to raise money for items lost.

title: Employee Transfer
description: Pam is the only one wearing a costume on Halloween. Holly and Michael take the long trip to Nashua after they get some shocking news from corporate.

title: Customer Survey
description: Dwight and Jim are shocked by the results of the annual customer survey report. Pam and Jim spend every minute together via Bluetooth.

title: Business Trip
description: Michael is ecstatic when he's sent on a business trip. Andy and Oscar become unlikely friends when Michael decides to bring them along.

title: Frame Toby
description: Someone makes a huge mess in the microwave and will not clean it up. Michael realizes that changes in his staff have occurred without his knowing.

title: The Surplus
description: Michael learns that the office must spend a $4300 surplus or lose it, and chaos breaks out as everyone fights to get what they want.

title: Moroccan Christmas
description: Phyllis's party goes up in flames when Meredith's hair catches on fire, and Dwight corners the market on the hottest toy of the Christmas season.

title: The Duel
description: Andy still doesn't know about Angela's affair with Dwight. When Michael spills the beans, Dwight and Andy take matters into their own hands.

title: Prince Family Paper
description: Michael and Dwight go undercover to spy on a rival paper company. Meanwhile, the rest of the office debates a burning question: Is Hilary Swank hot?

title: Stress Relief: Part 1
description: Dwight's fire drill causes Stanley to collapse from a heart attack. Afterward, Dwight must try to make amends to the stressed-out office.

title: Stress Relief: Part 2
description: When Michael learns that his frazzled employees consider him their number one stressor at work, he insists on a no-holds-barred roast of himself.

title: Lecture Circuit: Part 1
description: Michael visits other branches to explain Scranton's relative success. Dwight and Jim, heading the party-planning committee, forget a birthday.

title: Lecture Circuit: Part 2
description: Michael and Pam continue their tour of the branches. Dwight and Jim struggle with their party-planning duties. Angela's new cat causes a stir.

title: Blood Drive
description: On Valentine's Day, Michael meets a mysterious woman, Dwight and Kevin find single women, and Jim and Pam are banished for public affection.

title: Golden Ticket
description: Michael causes a huge problem when he comes up with the idea to put "golden tickets" into packages of paper for clients to redeem for discounts.

title: New Boss
description: Michael has big plans for his 15th anniversary party, but the company's new, no-nonsense vice president has some ideas of his own.

title: Two Weeks
description: Michael's relationship with the new vice president becomes increasingly tense, Pam battles a new copier and Kelly develops a crush.

title: Dream Team
description: After making a bad impression on his new boss, Jim runs into him during a parking lot soccer game. Meanwhile, Michael is afraid to leave his house.

title: Michael Scott Paper Company
description: Dwight and Andy plan a hunting trip. Asked for a "rundown," Jim spends his day figuring out what that is. Michael hosts a Paper & Pancakes lunch.

title: Heavy Competition
description: Dwight's loyalty to Michael is tested when he finds a new hero in Charles. Meanwhile, Andy tries to provide for all of Jim's emotional needs.

title: Broke
description: Michael's new company struggles to make early-morning deliveries, while the office tries to get their expense reports in on time.

title: Casual Friday
description: Michael mediates a dispute within his new sales team. Meanwhile, trouble brews among several employees over the term "Casual Fridays."

title: Cafe Disco
description: Michael gets into the café/disco scene. Meanwhile, Pam and Jim decide to take a secret trip.

title: Company Picnic
description: Michael and Holly are reunited at the annual company picnic, where the office also competes in the picnic's volleyball tournament.

title: Gossip
description: Michael feels left out as the rest of the office gossips about the summer interns. Meanwhile, Andy struggles with heterosexuality.

title: The Meeting
description: A request by Jim leaves Michael feeling insecure and defensive. Meanwhile, Pam deals with the guest list for the wedding.

title: The Promotion
description: David Wallace breaks the bad news that not everyone will get a raise this year, and Dwight reaches his breaking point with Jim.

title: Niagara: Part 1
description: In part 1 of a 2-part episode, the office travels to Niagara Falls to celebrate Jim and Pam's wedding under orders not to mention Pam's pregnancy.

title: Niagara: Part 2
description: In part 2 of a 2-part episode, Michael, Dwight and Andy all want to hook up with guests at Jim and Pam's wedding, and Michael and Dwight meet twins.

title: Mafia
description: Michael meets with an insurance salesman in the office, but Dwight and Andy think he's part of the mafia. Erin accidentally ruins Pam's painting.

title: The Lover
description: Michael shocks Jim and Pam when he reveals the identity of the new woman he's been dating. Dwight apologizes to Jim with a strange peace offering.

title: Koi Pond
description: Michael gets teased by everyone at the office after he takes an embarrassing fall at a meeting. Pam and Andy go on a sales call together.

title: Double Date
description: Jim and Pam have no choice but to go out with Michael and Helene. Strangely, Dwight is doing nice things for everyone in the office.

title: Murder
description: Michael forces the office into a day of strange diversions, upsetting Jim and leading others to wonder if Michael has gone insane.

title: Shareholder Meeting
description: Michael gets excited when he's invited by David Wallace to be honored onstage at the Dunder Mifflin shareholder meeting in New York.

title: Scott's Tots
description: Michael can't keep a promise he made to a group of kids 10 years ago. Meanwhile, Jim starts an Employee of the Month program to improve morale.

title: Secret Santa
description: Michael is outraged when Jim allows Phyllis to be Santa at the office Christmas party. Jim and Dwight try to get everyone into the holiday spirit.

title: The Banker
description: When a potential buyer visits, Michael, Dwight, Andy and Pam pull out all the stops in hopes of impressing him with their high-profile contacts.

title: Sabre
description: Michael struggles to accept Sabre's new policies; Pam and Jim interview with a prestigious daycare; Andy and Erin work on a welcome song for Sabre.

title: Manager and the Salesman
description: The office loves Sabre CEO Jo Bennett, until she says that there can't be two branch managers and that either Michael or Jim must go back to sales.

title: Delivery: Part 1
description: Pam's contractions begin, and the rest of the office tries to distract her from the pain with food and entertainment.

title: Delivery: Part 2
description: Everybody plays the waiting game as Pam prepares to give birth. Dwight decides to fix the cabinets in Pam and Jim's kitchen.

title: St. Patrick's Day
description: Michael mistakenly believes that he impressed Jo; Dwight disrupts Jim's first day back from paternity leave; Andy and Erin have an unusual first date.

title: New Leads
description: When the sales staff lets Sabre's new "sales is king" policy get to their heads, Michael hides their new, prized leads.

title: Happy Hour
description: Michael gets kicked out of the bar when he tries to impress a friend of Jim and Pam's. Andy and Erin try to keep their relationships under wraps.

title: Secretary's Day
description: Andy pulls out all the stops for Erin on Secretary's Day, but when Michael takes her to lunch, he lets slip about Andy's relationship with Angela.

title: Body Language
description: Pam and Jim work on their first sales pitch to a local restaurant, while Dwight encourages Kelly to try out for the minority training program.

title: The Cover-Up
description: Michael has Dwight investigate when he suspects Donna is cheating. Meanwhile, Andy is frustrated when no one takes his customer's complaint seriously.

title: The Chump
description: Michael is oddly upbeat after hearing bad news about Donna; new parents Pam and Jim can't stay awake; Dwight won't honor his contract with Angela.

title: Whistleblower
description: When the press reports that Sabre's printers catch on fire, Jo hunts for the whistleblower. Everyone suspects Andy, who denies leaking the story.

title: Nepotism
description: Michael refuses to fire the office assistant, and Andy plays it cool after Erin shows interest in another man. Meanwhile, Pam plays an office prank.

title: Counseling
description: Michael goes to Toby for counseling, and Dwight vows revenge after a shop owner snubs him. Meanwhile, Pam conspires to change her job title.

title: Andy's Play
description: Andy invites the entire office to his community theater production of "Sweeney Todd," while Jim and Pam struggle with their incompetent babysitter.

title: Sex Ed
description: Michael, believing he has herpes, contacts all his ex-girlfriends. Andy tries to play on Erin's compassionate side by holding a sex education meeting.

title: The Sting
description: When a competing sales associate steals a Dunder Mifflin client, Michael, Jim and Dwight set up a sting to find out his secrets. Andy starts a band.

title: Costume Contest
description: When Darryl takes an idea to corporate over his head, Michael freaks out. Everyone gets competitive as the Halloween costume contest gets underway.

title: Christening
description: Michael invites the entire office to celebrate the christening of Pam and Jim's baby, Cece.

title: Viewing Party
description: Erin and Gabe invite the office over for a "Glee" viewing party. Michael deals poorly with people calling Gabe his boss. Andy grows jealous of Gabe.

title: WUPHF.com
description: More than money is at stake as Michael helps charm people into investing in Ryan's start-up. Dwight creates a hay festival in the parking lot.

title: China
description: After reading about China growing as a global power, Michael decides China must be stopped before it takes over the United States.

title: Classy Christmas: Part 1
description: Toby has to take a leave of absence and corporate sends Holly Flax to cover for him. Michael forces Pam to throw a second Christmas party.

title: Classy Christmas: Part 2
description: Michael wants to throw a second Christmas party to celebrate Holly's returns to Scranton. Jim regrets agreeing to a snowball fight with Dwight.

title: Ultimatum
description: Michael prepares himself for the good or bad news about Holly and her boyfriend. Pam puts up a board for everyone to post New Year's resolutions.

title: The Seminar
description: Dealing with low sales, Andy holds a business seminar with the help of some special guests. Michael and Holly turn the event into an improv challenge.

title: The Search
description: When Jim gets an emergency call from Helene, he leaves Michael in the bathroom of a gas station. Holly, Erin and Dwight set out to find Michael.

title: PDA
description: It's Valentine's Day, and Michael and Holly's displays of affection are making everyone uncomfortable. A champagne lunch causes complications.

title: Threat Level Midnight
description: After 11 years in the making, Michael is finally ready to present his movie, "Threat Level Midnight," to his co-workers and love interest, Holly.

title: Todd Packer
description: After many years and motel rooms, traveling salesman (and Michael's best friend) Todd is ready to leave the road and take a desk job in the office.

title: Garage Sale
description: The warehouse and office staff hold a garage sale; Michael seeks his coworkers' advice on an important decision.

title: Training Day
description: Everyone hopes to make a good first impression on the new manager: Andy finds himself typecast, while Jim and Pam worry they've come on too strong.

title: Michael's Last Dundies
description: Michael trains Deangeleo to take over the job of hosting the Dundie Awards. Erin struggles with her dislike of her boyfriend, Gabe.

title: Goodbye, Michael
description: Michael, about to leave for Colorado, says his goodbyes to each co-worker. Deangelo and Andy scramble to keep Michael's biggest clients.

title: The Inner Circle
description: Deangelo's true management style is finally revealed.

title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager
description: Dwight takes over as acting manager and applies Draconian tactics to the office. Meanwhile, Gabe tries to win Erin back.

title: Search Committee: Part 1
description: Jim heads a search committee that interviews the managerial candidates, including Andy and Darryl. Dwight tries to get back in the race.

title: Search Committee: Part 2
description: Jim heads a search committee that interviews the managerial candidates, including Andy and Darryl. Dwight tries to get back in the race.

title: The List
description: The staff is hit with a double whammy as Scranton gets a new regional manager and Robert California takes the helm of Dunder Mifflin Sabre as CEO.

title: The Incentive
description: Robert California wants to double sales growth, and Andy responds with an unusual incentive plan to motivate the team.

title: Lotto
description: When the warehouse crew quits after winning the lotto, the team pitches in to keep Dunder Mifflin humming.

title: Garden Party
description: Trying to gain some respect from his family and new boss, Andy throws a garden party at Schrute Farms.

title: Spooked
description: Erin struggles to pull off the ultimate Halloween party, juggling the expectations of Robert California, Andy and the staff.

title: Doomsday
description: Challenged to improve productivity, Dwight develops an accountability booster program that threatens to get the entire office fired.

title: Pam's Replacement
description: Pam's convinced her temp replacement is the apple of Jim's eye; Robert California has a musical proposition for Andy, Darryl and Kevin.

title: Gettysburg
description: Andy tries to fire up the team with a trip to Gettysburg; Robert California challenges the team to think way outside the box.

title: Mrs. California
description: Andy's in a tough spot when Robert California sends him mixed messages about hiring his wife.

title: Christmas Wishes
description: Andy wants to make everyone's Christmas wishes come true -- no matter how distraught they are.

title: Trivia
description: Pressed to boost the bottom line, Andy finds a novel way to improve sales, while Dwight explores corporate opportunities outside Scranton.

title: Pool Party
description: Robert invites the staff to his house for one last party before the home goes up for sale.

title: Jury Duty
description: Jim comes under fire when the office realizes he skipped work by faking jury duty to spend time with Pam and the new baby.

title: Special Project
description: Dwight is recruited to lead a team headed to Florida to create a chain of Sabre retail stores.

title: Tallahassee
description: To get noticed by Corporate, Dwight takes his team to Tallahassee to conceive a new chain of Sabre retail stores.

title: After Hours
description: Nellie pits Packer against Dwight for the VP job, Jim fends off an amorous intruder, and Andy works the Scranton team overtime.

title: Test the Store
description: Dwight plans an impressive presentation for the Sabre store, and Andy suffers an embarrassing injury.

title: Last Day in Florida
description: Robert hates Nellie's business plan, and Jim tries to save Dwight from being fired. Meanwhile, Andy learns that Erin isn't returning to Scranton.

title: Get the Girl
description: As Andy heads south to Florida to sweep Erin off her feet, Nellie makes herself at home in his office in Scranton.

title: Welcome Party
description: As Erin and Andy plot how he should break up with Jessica, Robert California orders the office to throw a welcome party for Nellie.

title: Angry Andy
description: Andy's job -- and manhood -- are called into question as he returns with Erin to Scranton.

title: Fundraiser
description: Unemployed Andy crashes a fundraiser for the Senator -- and ends up the unlikely owner of a dozen disabled dogs.

title: Turf War
description: A drunken Robert California closes a branch, igniting a sales war.

title: Free Family Portrait Studio
description: Dwight raises suspicions by offering free portraits; Andy returns with some self-satisfying news.

title: New Guys
description: Jim and Dwight are thrown off by the arrival of two young employees that the others dub "the new Jim" and "Dwight Jr." Andy returns from training.

title: Roy's Wedding
description: Pam and Jim go to Roy's wedding, where his toast takes everyone by surprise -- causing Pam and Jim to examine their own relationship.

title: Andy's Ancestry
description: Andy learns he is related to Michelle Obama, causing a stir around the office. Jim's elaborate trick has Dwight thinking Jim is an Asian man.

title: Work Bus
description: After Jim convinces Dwight that the building is unsafe, Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside -- and eventually they hit the road.

title: Here Comes Treble
description: It's Halloween in the office, and Andy invites his college a cappella group to perform, which leads to a confrontation with his frenemy Broccoli Rob.

title: The Boat
description: Andy must man up when his dad blows all of the family's money. When Dwight is interviewed on local radio, Jim tortures him with bizarre call-ins.

title: The Whale
description: To help Dwight overcome his greatest professional handicap -- selling to women -- Pam and the ladies teach him how to interact with female clients.

title: The Target
description: Angela discovers her husband's affair and goes to Dwight for help. Jim needs a favor from Stanley and Phyllis, who milk it for all it's worth.

title: Dwight Christmas
description: When the party planning committee drops the ball on the Christmas party, Dwight gets everyone to celebrate a traditional Schrute German Christmas.

title: Lice
description: Pam accidentally brings lice into the office and lets Meredith take the fall. Meanwhile, Jim woos a potential business associate in Philadelphia.

title: Suit Warehouse
description: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to make a sale. Meanwhile, Darryl interviews at Jim's company and Pam comes for a surprise visit.

title: Customer Loyalty
description: Dwight tries to prevent Darryl's move to Athlead. Jim is forced to miss Cece's first recital when a big investor exits his new company.

title: Junior Salesman
description: David Wallace tasks Dwight with finding a new part-time salesman to fill in for Jim. Dwight assembles a super-team of his cronies, starting with Mose.

title: Vandalism
description: When Pam's warehouse mural is defaced, Dwight and Nellie spring to action. Darryl has difficulty dealing with Jim's habits in their shared apartment.

title: Couple's Discount
description: The office pairs off into pretend couples to take advantage of a Valentine's Day discount at the mall. Erin assures Pete she will break up with Andy.

title: Moving On
description: Pam interviews for a job in Philadelphia with a manager who gives her deja-vu. Dwight brings Angela on a mission to clean his elderly Aunt Shirley.

title: The Farm
description: Dwight travels home for a customary Schrute funeral. He and his siblings receive a surprise inheritance that's not entirely welcome.

title: Promos
description: Everyone is excited when promos start running on TV for the documentary. Dwight makes Angela jealous when he starts dating a Brussels sprout farmer.

title: Stairmageddon
description: "Stairmaggedon" strikes when the elevator goes out and everyone is forced to take the stairs. Dwight forces Stanley to do an important sales call.

title: Paper Airplane
description: Dwight and Angela compete in an office-wide paper airplane contest. A local talent agent helps Andy with his first acting role in an industrial film.

title: Livin' the Dream
description: Andy tries to work up the nerve to quit his job and pursue his dreams of stardom. Dwight finally receives his karate black belt from his new sensei.

title: A.A.R.M
description: While the office readies for the documentary premiere, Jim holds tryouts to hire an assistant to the assistant to the regional manager.

title: Finale
description: In the series finale, months after the airing of the documentary, the workers of Dunder Mifflin, past and present, gather for a wedding.
